FOUND-001.title: Conduct Foundation Event Storm for Foundation
FOUND-001.description:
Complete the foundation by capturing domain architecture through Foundation Event Storm.

Use these commands to populate foundation.json eventStorm field:
- fspec add-foundation-bounded-context <name>
- fspec add-aggregate-to-foundation <context> <aggregate>
- fspec add-domain-event-to-foundation <context> <event>
- fspec show-foundation-event-storm

Why this matters:
- Establishes bounded contexts for domain-driven design
- Enables tag ontology generation from domain model
- Provides foundation for architectural documentation
- Supports EXMAP-004 tag discovery workflow

See spec/CLAUDE.md "Foundation Event Storm" section for detailed guidance.

COMP-001.title: Simplify SearchBar debounce implementation
COMP-001.description: Refactor SearchBar component to use a single useEffect or custom hook for debouncing, eliminating the dependency array issue with onChangeText callback. Current implementation has two useEffect hooks that can cause unnecessary re-renders when parent doesn't memoize the callback.

JAM-001.title: Setup project dependencies and package structure
JAM-001.description: Install RTK Query, audio libraries (expo-audio, react-native-audio-pro), FlashList, environment variables support. Create rtk-services and components package directories

userStory.action: set up project dependencies and package structure
userStory.benefit: I can start building features with the required libraries

questions.text: @human: Should we install @reduxjs/toolkit and configure RTK Query with a base API service, or just install the package?
questions.answer: RTK Query is already configured in @packages/rtk-services/, so we can skip this

questions.text: @human: Should we install both expo-audio and react-native-audio-pro, or choose one? What's the preferred audio solution?
@human: For the rtk-services package, should it be named @jamendo/rtk-services? What about the components package name?
@human: What specific environment variables need to be configured besides EXPO_PUBLIC_JAMENDO_CLIENT_ID?
@human: Should FlashList replace existing FlatList usage in the codebase, or is it only for new features?
questions.answer: No FlatList exists currently. Use FlashList for all list implementations going forward. Do not remove or touch FlatList if found.

rules.text: expo-audio must be installed for audio playback functionality
@shopify/flash-list must be installed for performant list rendering
Environment variables must be configured in .env file with EXPO_PUBLIC_JAMENDO_CLIENT_ID (required)
All installed packages must appear in package.json dependencies
@jamendo/components package must be added as dependency in apps/example
@jamendo/rtk-services package must be added as dependency in apps/example

examples.text: Developer runs 'pnpm add expo-audio' in apps/example directory, expo-audio appears in package.json
Developer runs 'pnpm add @shopify/flash-list' in apps/example directory, @shopify/flash-list appears in package.json
Developer creates .env file in apps/example with EXPO_PUBLIC_JAMENDO_CLIENT_ID=test_client_id
Developer runs 'pnpm install' and all packages install successfully without errors
Developer adds @jamendo/components as dependency in apps/example/package.json
Developer adds @jamendo/rtk-services as dependency in apps/example/package.json

architectureNotes.text: Implementation approach: Add workspace dependencies (@jamendo/components, @jamendo/rtk-services) to apps/example/package.json using workspace:* protocol. Install npm packages (expo-audio, @shopify/flash-list) directly. Create .env file with EXPO_PUBLIC_JAMENDO_CLIENT_ID. Alignment: Follows existing monorepo structure and workspace dependency pattern already used for @jamendo/feature-home.

JAM-002.title: Configure RTK Services package with Jamendo API
JAM-002.description: Create @jamendo/rtk-services package with baseApi, jamendoApi endpoints (searchTracks, getTrackDetail), TypeScript types, and Redux store configuration

userStory.action: integrate Jamendo API using RTK Query
userStory.benefit: I can search tracks and fetch track details with automatic caching

rules.text: Base API must be configured with Jamendo API v3.0 endpoint (https://api.jamendo.com/v3.0)
All API requests must include client_id from EXPO_PUBLIC_JAMENDO_CLIENT_ID environment variable
Search endpoint must request minimal fields (id, name, artist_name, image) for optimal performance
Detail endpoint must request full track data including audio URL with mp31 format
Redux store must be configured with jamendoApi reducer and RTK Query middleware
API responses must be fully typed with TypeScript interfaces
When track detail returns empty results, endpoint must return a 'track not found' message instead of throwing an error

examples.text: Developer calls useSearchTracksQuery('jazz') and receives results with id, name, artist_name, and image fields only
Developer calls useGetTrackDetailQuery('12345') and receives full track data including audio URL
Search request is made to https://api.jamendo.com/v3.0/tracks with namesearch parameter and limit=20
Detail request is made to https://api.jamendo.com/v3.0/tracks with id parameter and audioformat=mp31
Store is created with jamendoApi reducer at 'jamendoApi' path and RTK Query middleware configured
Developer imports JamendoTrack, JamendoSearchResponse types and gets full TypeScript autocomplete
Detail endpoint transforms response array to single track object, throwing error if track not found
Developer calls useGetTrackDetailQuery('99999999') for non-existent track and receives {error: 'track not found'} response

questions.text: @human: Should the search endpoint use 'namesearch' parameter (searches track names and artist names), or should we also support other search types like 'search' (full-text) or 'artist_name'?
questions.answer: Use 'namesearch' parameter (current implementation) which searches both track names and artist names

questions.text: @human: When track detail is not found (empty results array), should we throw an error or return null/undefined?
questions.answer: Return a message 'track not found' instead of throwing an error (needs implementation change)

questions.text: @human: Should we validate that EXPO_PUBLIC_JAMENDO_CLIENT_ID is set, or let API requests fail with 401?
questions.answer: Let API requests fail with 401 - no upfront validation needed (current implementation is correct)

architectureNotes.text: RTK Query configuration using @reduxjs/toolkit with fetchBaseQuery. Base API endpoint: https://api.jamendo.com/v3.0. Search endpoint uses minimal fields (id, name, artist_name, image) for list views. Detail endpoint includes audio URL with mp31 format and musicinfo+lyrics.

Implementation change needed: getTrackDetail transformResponse should return {error: 'track not found'} for empty results instead of throwing exception. This allows components to handle track-not-found gracefully without error boundaries.

Store configuration exports configured store with jamendoApi reducer at 'jamendoApi' path and RTK Query middleware. Exports RootState and AppDispatch types for typed hooks. All API types (JamendoTrack, JamendoSearchResponse, JamendoTrackDetailResponse) exported for TypeScript autocomplete.

JAM-003.title: Configure Components package with audio players and UI
JAM-003.description: Create @jamendo/components package with ExpoAudioPlayer, AudioProPlayer, TrackCard, TrackList (FlashList), and SearchBar components

JAM-004.title: Configure environment variables and Jamendo API client
JAM-004.description: Setup .env file with EXPO_PUBLIC_JAMENDO_CLIENT_ID, update app.json for environment variables, create config.ts constants file

userStory.benefit: I can access the Jamendo API without hardcoding sensitive keys

rules.text: .env file must be created in apps/example/ directory with EXPO_PUBLIC_JAMENDO_CLIENT_ID and EXPO_PUBLIC_JAMENDO_API_URL
Environment variables must use EXPO_PUBLIC_ prefix to be accessible in Expo app
.env file must be gitignored to prevent committing sensitive credentials
config.ts file must export typed constants from environment variables
config.ts must provide validation that required environment variables are set
.env.example file must be kept up to date as template for developers
config.ts must throw error at module load time (fail fast) if required environment variables are missing

examples.text: Developer creates .env file with EXPO_PUBLIC_JAMENDO_CLIENT_ID=abc123 and can access it via process.env
Developer imports { JAMENDO_CLIENT_ID, JAMENDO_API_URL } from config.ts and uses typed constants
Developer forgets to set EXPO_PUBLIC_JAMENDO_CLIENT_ID and app throws clear error message at startup
Developer runs 'git status' and .env file is not shown (gitignored)
New developer clones repo, copies .env.example to .env, adds their client ID, and app works
config.ts exports JAMENDO_CLIENT_ID as non-nullable string after validation

questions.text: @human: Should config.ts throw an error at module load time if variables are missing, or return undefined and let callers handle it?
questions.answer: Throw error at module load time if required environment variables are missing - fail fast approach

questions.text: @human: Should we add any other environment variables now (like API timeout, max retries), or just the two from .env.example?
questions.answer: Stick with the two existing variables from .env.example (JAMENDO_CLIENT_ID and JAMENDO_API_URL)

questions.text: @human: Where should config.ts be located - in apps/example/ or in a shared package?
questions.answer: Place config.ts in apps/example/ directory for now, can move to shared package later if needed

architectureNotes.text: Expo environment variables use EXPO_PUBLIC_ prefix for client-side access. config.ts validates required variables at module load time (fail-fast). .env file gitignored for security. .env.example provides template.

JAM-005.title: Integrate Redux Provider in app root layout
JAM-005.description: Update apps/example/app/_layout.tsx to wrap app with Redux Provider and configure store

userStory.action: use Redux state management throughout the app
userStory.benefit: I have centralized state and API caching available in all screens

questions.text: @human: Should Redux Provider wrap ThemeProvider, or vice versa? What's the correct nesting order for providers?
questions.answer: ThemeProvider wraps Redux Provider (Provider is nested inside ThemeProvider)

questions.text: @human: Should we enable Redux DevTools integration for development builds?
questions.answer: Yes, enable Redux DevTools integration for development builds

rules.text: Redux Provider must be placed in the root layout to make store accessible to all screens
Provider must be configured with the store from @jamendo/rtk-services package
Integration must not break existing navigation or theme functionality
Redux DevTools must be enabled in development builds for debugging

examples.text: Developer imports Provider and store in _layout.tsx and wraps app tree
Screen component uses useSearchTracksQuery hook and successfully fetches data through Redux store
User switches between light and dark themes, theme continues to work with Redux Provider present
User navigates between tabs, navigation works normally with Redux store available
Developer opens Redux DevTools in development build and sees current store state with API cache

architectureNotes.text: Redux Provider integration in apps/example/app/_layout.tsx using @jamendo/rtk-services package. Provider wraps app inside existing ThemeProvider to maintain theme functionality. Store configuration imported from @jamendo/rtk-services/src/store.ts with baseApi RTK Query service pre-configured. Redux DevTools configured via __DEV__ flag for development-only enablement.

JAM-006.title: Build Home page with search and track results
JAM-006.description: Implement search screen at apps/example/app/(tabs)/index.tsx with SearchBar, RTK Query integration (useSearchTracksQuery), TrackList with FlashList, and navigation to track detail

userStory.action: search for tracks and view results
userStory.benefit: I can discover and explore music on Jamendo

rules.text: Search bar must be visible at the top of the home screen
Track results must be displayed using FlashList for performance
Search must use RTK Query useSearchTracksQuery hook
Tapping a track must navigate to track detail screen

examples.text: User opens home screen and sees search bar with placeholder text 'Search tracks...'
User types 'jazz' in search bar and sees list of jazz tracks with titles, artists, and album art
User taps on a track from search results and is taken to track detail screen showing full track information
User searches for tracks and can scroll through results smoothly using FlashList

architectureNotes.text: Implementation will be in apps/example/app/(tabs)/index.tsx using Expo Router file-based navigation
Uses RTK Query useSearchTracksQuery hook from @jamendo/rtk-services package for API integration with Jamendo API
Track list uses FlashList from @shopify/flash-list for performant rendering of large lists
Navigation to track detail uses Expo Router's useRouter hook for programmatic navigation

JAM-007.title: Build Track detail page with dual audio players
JAM-007.description: Implement track detail screen at apps/example/app/track/[id].tsx with ScrollView layout, track information, and both ExpoAudioPlayer and AudioProPlayer for comparison

JAM-008.title: Update navigation and tab bar configuration
JAM-008.description: Update apps/example/app/(tabs)/_layout.tsx to rename tabs, add music-related icons, and configure stack navigation for track detail page

JAM-009.title: Testing and validation of complete app
JAM-009.description: Verify API usage optimization (minimal vs full fields), test both audio player implementations, validate FlashList performance, test navigation flow, and verify Redux DevTools integration

JAM-010.title: Optimize CI pipeline - remove duplicate lint, typecheck, and build steps
